snippet: Officials expressed frustration Friday with hardware and software problems that continued to complicate the federal health insurance website.
abstract: Jeffrey D Zients, Pres Obama's troubleshooter to fix federal health insurance Web site, says there is progress but still some roadblocks; federal officials say they have spent $630 million on information technology for site, and express frustration with hardware and software problems that continue to plague it; technical issues are thwarting millions of people trying to buy insurance in the online market.
lead_paragraph: Officials expressed frustration Friday with hardware and software problems that continued to complicate the federal health insurance website.

headline.main: Troubleshooter Reports Progress and Barriers in Bid to Repair Health Portal
headline.print_headline: Troubleshooter Reports Progress and Barriers in Bid to Repair Health Portal

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
